intro: Cionomene, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elongated and pointed. Its stem is woody and can climb by means of tendrils or by adhering to surfaces. Cionomene is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in full sun with well-drained soil.
